intro: Hymenopus heteromorphus, commonly known as the variable hymenopus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and palmate leaves. Its flowers are bisexual and produce small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Hymenopus heteromorphus is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates.
